urls_and_parsers¶

This module provides different parsers (children of Parser) to obtain the necessary data to fill the Anki-cards.

Each parser returns a dict, that can directly be used by the pt_word.Word.update_from_dict() method of the pt_word.Word class.

Module Contents¶

Classes¶

Parser()

Base class for parsers.

LingueeParser()

Uses Linguee to obtain: translation, word_type, gender and audio_url

DicioParser()

Uses Dicio to obtain: explanations, synonyms, antonyms, examples, add_info_dict, conj_table_html

ReversoParser()

Uses Reverso to obtain: examples

Strips each line of a string of leading and trailing whitespace.

Exctracts suggested corrections if the original search is not successful.

class urls_and_parsers.Parser[source]¶

Base class for parsers.

Main functionality is the result_dict function.

phrase :str[source]¶

The word or phrase to search the site for.

from_lang :str[source]¶

Target language.

to_lang :str[source]¶

Source Language.

base_url =[source]¶

URL to make request to. Can contain every class attribute. E.g. https://some.url/{phrase}/dest={from_lang};src={to_lang}.html

headers :dict[source]¶

Headers for the request. Defaults to DEFAULT_HEADERS.

setup(self)[source]¶

Stuff that needs to be executed before url() is called.

url(self)[source]¶

Get url for http-request.

Returns

base_url formatted with all class attributes.

make_request(self, url=None)[source]¶

Uses headers to make an http-request via get()

Parameters

url – If None, will be set to url(). (Default value = None)

Returns

Response object

parse_response(self, response: requests.Response)[source]¶
Parameters

response (Response) – Response to parse.

Returns

Dictionary with extracted information.

result_dict(self, phrase=None)[source]¶
Parameters

phrase – If None, uses phrase. (Default value = None)

Returns

Result of parse_response().
